Description: An infection in any part of the urinary system, commonly the bladder and urethra, characterized by burning urination, frequent urges, and abdominal discomfort.
A condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough hormones, leading to slowed metabolism, fatigue, and cold sensitivity.
An anxiety disorder causing sudden and repeated episodes of intense fear accompanied by physical symptoms like palpitations and chest pain.
Inflammation or swelling of the sinuses, often due to infection, resulting in facial pain, nasal congestion, and thick discharge.
A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever, severe pain, and rash, with potential for dangerous complications like bleeding or shock.
Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to cough, mucus production, and chest discomfort, often triggered by infections or irritants.
A condition marked by a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin, causing fatigue, weakness, and pale skin.
A degenerative joint disease where cartilage wears down over time, leading to joint pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
A neurological disorder marked by recurrent seizures due to abnormal brain activity.
Inflammation of the stomach lining, often caused by infection, alcohol, or NSAID use, leading to pain, nausea, and bloating.
An allergic reaction causing sneezing, runny nose, and nasal congestion, triggered by allergens like pollen or dust.
A neurological condition with intense throbbing headaches, often accompanied by nausea, light sensitivity, and visual disturbances (aura).
A mental health disorder characterized by persistent sadness, loss of interest, and physical and emotional problems that impair daily functioning.
